thread.title: Rutgers win vs. Indiana last year a statistical outlier
thread.title_full: Rutgers win vs. Indiana last year a statistical outlier

author: app.com
title: Rutgers win vs. Indiana last year a statistical outlier
text:
MORE PISCATAWAY When its opponent rushes for less than 100 yards, Rutgers is 14-6 in four seasons under coach Kyle Flood and 50-16 since 2000.
As expected, the odds of winning increase when Rutgers opponents rush for fewer than 50 yards (25-3 since 2000) and decrease when opponents reach 100 or more (11-13 under Flood).
In that case, last season’s game against Indiana is the ultimate outlier, with Rutgers earning a 22-point victory despite allowing a record-setting 307 rushing yards to halfback Tevin Coleman.
Coleman won’t be part of the rematch, but Indiana coach Kevin Wilson still has a rushing attack averaging more than 200 yards per game at his disposal in Saturday’s rematch against Rutgers.
“It’s one of the misnomers sometimes when people think of the spread offense,” Flood said. “They think all spread offenses want to throw it around the way Baylor does.
"But Coach Wilson has always valued running the ball. I think even in some of his comments this week he’s spoken to wanting to run the ball more, so I think we’re going to get a good dose of it.”
